sense.name: a span of time in which an awaited event is delayed
sense.commentary: POSTPONEMENT[+quantity][+span][+temporal][+delay][+of_action][+awaited] Note: refers to the time span when something did not happen
sense.examples: There was a thirty-second postponement in the broadcast, due to a network failure. These postponements in production while the machinery is serviced are costing us money.

sense.name: an intentional act of delaying, deferring something
sense.commentary: POSTPONEMENT[+event][+act][+intentional][+delay] Note: refers to an agent's deciding to delay something
sense.examples: The doctor became annoyed with Bob's postponements of his annual physical. She sent email announcing a postponement of the meeting until Thursday.
